Posts.Content: rleedorman wrote: Hey all....this is Rachel again. Just got my mammo and ultrasound results and am not happy! I have a cyst that my PCP knows about, it can felt and was on mammo 4 years ago said to be benign....it hasn't changed so that isn't my concern; the concern is there is not one single mention of this cyst at all on either of my reports from yesterday's imaging. Stated in the mammo is "breast parenchyma is heterogeneously moderately dense" and no significant findings. BI-RADS is Cat 3 probable benign findings. Impression on ultrasound is "negative bilateral breast ultrasound. Dense fibroglandular changes. I am beside myself right now because even the obvious was not noted on either one of these - really need some advice.....this just frustrates the life out of me! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: RESULTS and NEED ADVICE ASAP PLEASE rleedorman rleedorman

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 02:07PM rleedorman wrote: Sherburton, OMGosh!  What you have going on is EXACTLY what I am going through right now with the swelling in the armpit area and my discomfort is when lifting my arm out.  The discomfort is not in the muscle, it is where the swelling is; this has been going on for a couple/few months.  I also have a bb-sized bump in the breast on that side which previously has been diagnosed as benign and nothing to worry about.  I just posted on here asking for some advice as I had diagnostic mammo and ultrasound this morning.  Please keep us posted on what you find out!  Prayers are with you!
Posts.Title: Any advice would be helpful/very much appreciated sherrbear BikerBabe1

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 02:38PM rleedorman wrote: I have pain in the deep area but contributed that to me checking for anything because of the swelling, which does affeect my upper arm as well.  When I lift my arm up and out, I get pain in armpit and under upper arm.  It definately does not feel like muscle.

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 03:07PM rleedorman wrote: I've never had swelling in my armpit before, especially not with a burning-type sensation on and off.  It's hard to explain the sensation but it's deep.  Hopefully mammo and ultrasound results are available Monday.....I hate sitting on this just because of the fatigue and overall unwell feeling.  The steroid shot I was given was to help with discomfort in shoulders and swelling but it has done nothing as far as swelling is concerned.  He had also given me a B12 injection to help with fatigue and am still just as exhausted as I was before.  I have been back to him twice about this same issue.  Thanks so very much for your input.....greatly appreciated! Sherburton, you are in my prayers so please keep us posted!
